title: itf991
author: itf991
content: We are going through cycles and it's getting harder and harder to pick the wining horse amongst the new projects. I myself have lost faith with any of these new shiny promises. I'm currently revising the old trusted altcoins and came to a conclusion that LTC is an undervalued asset class. Do you guys think that it has a potential to regain it's place as silver of all crytos and being ranked in the top 5 on CMC??

The era for the old coin already ended. You need to open with the new tokens that came to the market.

comments.author: RussianEnglishTranslation
comments.body: Litecoin may have a brief pump now that it integrated privacy but long term, coins that do not offer smart contract functionality will not be successful. That's why I invested mainly in Hedera Hashgraph and Candle Chain. Hedera is scalable and has the best partners in the industry and Candle Chain has 0 transaction fees and is engineered to host metaverse DApps, including their own.

comments.body: IMO, and Honestly speaking I'm not convinced anymore that Litecoin will regain its former status as the silver standard next to Bitcoin because if we examine closely the crypto market lately there are a lot of new Blockchains with competitive coins armed by multiple use cases and backed by a strong community of users and investors thats why I believe Litecoin was already behind in the race especially more on "technical aspect" thats why for me, it was not really an undervalued coin. so I guess we must ride with the flow so that we are not tied up with the past.

comments.body: Quote from: itf991 on May 23, 2022, 12:52:58 PMI'm currently revising the old trusted altcoins and came to a conclusion that LTC is an undervalued asset class.Litecoin undervalued? Any price above $0 is overvalued for things like Litecoin, Dogecoin, Bitcoin Cash, Bitcoin SV and every other fork or copy of bitcoin. Not that I'm disagreed with hard forking, but whoever began all of those coins had no intention to promote censorship-resistance and financial sovereignty whatsoever. Presumably, he did it for fun, or to make a quick buck in a smart way.Fortunately, we've escaped from this "digital silver" gibberish, please don't bring it back. If only the problem with scaling could be resolved with solving blocks more frequently, that is in litecoin.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: Who knows... I got surprise days ago after seeing litecoin is still a popular currency among crypto gamblers, raising its usage from 3,5% last year to 6,45% this year.Quote from: uneng on May 21, 2022, 12:40:56 AMCrypto Bet: A wider Array of Altcoins are being usefImage sourceMoreover, litecoin has integrated recently the called Mimblewimble protocol, which promises to enable users to send confidential transactions. Depending how it's going to be received by the market and how useful it's going to be for real, MimbleWimble can be indeed a booster for litecoin adoption.QuoteWith Mimblewimble Extension Block, users of the network can opt-in to confidential transactions. The end goal is to enhance the viability of Litecoin as a fungible currency that can be used for real-world transactions by lowering fees and adding privacy, throughput, and scalability.Although there are controversies:QuoteThe OG cypherpunk Adam Back was, however, not impressed by MWEB. While responding to a tweet that speculated many Bitcoiners believe that Bitcoin may soon activate the protocol, Back said that he does not think MWEB enhances much privacy:“IMO Mimble Wimble is not much of a privacy improvement as the transaction history will be recorded even if later elided, and the scaling gains only start to win at large size as transactions are bigger. also, receiver online is inconvenient. Confidential Transactions I like ofc.”Litecoin Activates MimbleWimble Extension Blocks (MWEB)
